turn_results.user_input: Should we use ROAS as our primary metric?
turn_results.agent_response:
Based on your input: implied cost per qualified demo = $150,000 ÷ 500 = $300.

ROAS (revenue/ad spend) is often misleading due to platform attribution; better to anchor on Cost per Qualified Demo (~$300 target) and blended CAC (customer acquisition cost), validated with incrementality tests.

Can we set the primary KPI to Cost per Qualified Demo at or under $300, with blended CAC as the secondary?

turn_results.user_input: What should we test?
turn_results.agent_response:
Got it. We’ll structure tests to hit Cost per Qualified Demo ≤$300 (based on your input) and improve blended customer acquisition cost (CAC).

Priority: offer/CTA, audience, landing page, lead capture, bidding, channel mix; success = lower Cost per Qualified Demo without quality drop; My estimate: 70% core, 20% structured A/Bs, 10% exploration.

What is the single biggest uncertainty you want to tackle first?

turn_results.user_input: What are the biggest risks?
turn_results.agent_response:
Based on your input: primary KPI = Cost per Qualified Demo ≤$300; secondary = blended customer acquisition cost (CAC).

Biggest risks: low lead quality, attribution over-crediting, limited qualified reach, funnel friction (landing page/form), slow sales follow-up; mitigation: tighter qualification, incrementality holdouts, audience exclusions/negatives, conversion rate optimization, 5-minute lead response.

Which of these concerns you most so we prioritize mitigation?
